snippet: Even if prosecutors were trying to discourage other potential leakers, the 35-year sentence is far too long.
abstract: Editorial contends Pfc Bradley Manning's 35-year sentence is too severe, given his stated desire not to betray his country but to shed light on realities of American war effort; notes prosecutors are attempting to discourage other leakers with sentence, but holds even threat of a severe prison sentence will not deter those who believe the government is too secretive.
lead_paragraph: Even if prosecutors were trying to discourage other potential leakers, the 35-year sentence is far too long.

headline.print_headline: What Happened to Clemency?: Bradley Manning’s sentence is excessive
